name: Kariega Game Reserve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodation was a 3 bedroom chalet; 2 were on suite, one had a separate bathroom. There was a kitchen and dining area and lounge with open fire; a balcony and private pool, there was only 2 of us! I think that was luck of the draw.
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were 2 game drives a day; the first at 6am (you get a wakeup call at 5:30am), which includes a tea/coffee stop. That lasts till 9am when they drop you off for breakfast. You have the day to yourself, and then the 2nd game drive is at 4pm which includes a stop to watch the sunset and have a drink. This goes on till about 7:30-8pm which is when they drop you off for dinner.
reviews.title: Had a great time

reviews.text: Our ranger was excellent, extremely knowledgeable and friendly. He made every effort to meet our requests for what we wanted to see on the drives and answered all our questions. He also took us canoeing one afternoon which was great fun.
reviews.title: Fantastic Game Reserve - Highly Recommended!!
Excellent!!
reviews.text: We had 3 meals a day, which were all delicious, and the service was superb.

reviews.title: Keriega Game Reserve review
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and saw all the animals apart from the elusive leopard. It was astonishing how close you get to the animals – even the lions!

We stayed here last week and although we had a fantastic time seeing the animals and the food was wonderful the accommodation was very disappointing considering it was supposed to be 4 star. Our lodge was very tatty with a number of problems from a filthy stained sink to a broken shower door. After staying in 6 other 4 star accommodation on the journey down to Kariega I have to say we were disappointed however the experience of seeing all the animals from big cats to elephants by far made up for it.
reviews.title: Disappointed by accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having never been on a safari before I didn't know what to expect. But what a treat! We stayed at the Main Lodge - the Ukhozi and the River Lodge are different and for those with a bigger budget.
reviews.title: What a beautiful place

reviews.text: Arrived at 4pm and very quickly checked in to our private chalet before our first game drive at 4.30pm (another one at 6am too). Chalet very comfortable, although relatively basic but very very OK - you're not there to lie in 5 star luxury after all - you're there for the animals! Game drives last for 3 hours plus each day, with a stop in the evening one for a drink at sunset (very stunning). Then back to the restaurant for dinner or breakfast. All meals are great and are generally buffet/self-service - plus sometimes they put on entertainment too (African dancing).
reviews.title: Not luxurious

reviews.text: All the big 5 are in the two areas of the reserve (one doesn't have predators); however we didn't see the hippos as they can be quite elusive. Lots and lots of animals to see, and we saw both the female and male lions, the elephant herd, lots of bok, birds, flora, etc. The ranger we had was very knowledgeable and extremely pleasant. It's an odd feeling sitting in an open top truck only 10 feet away from 2 lions that could easily pounce (it's absolutely fine though)!! Would highly recommend the Kariega.
reviews.title: Ok but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived slightly early to find that our lodge was not yet ready. We were however given the keys to it and decided we would go have a look at the restaurant and pool. First problem have bumped our way along the gravel and rocky path in the car we arrived at the restaurant/bar/pool area. Definatley not for the less mobile. We followed the rocky path to the pool and it was very nice BUT only 8 sun loungers. Oh dear. What would we do, we have 2 boys of 9 and 6 they would want to go swimming. Maybe things would get better. We went to investigate our lodge. Oh dear! 2 of the sinks were badly craked , the huge decking area neede repair. Backin the car and back to reception. They gave us keys to the lodge next door. Still cracked sinks. when we complained again and mentioned the lack of loungers at the pool we were advised we could aslways go to the beach 1/2 hour away. Not likely. They did move us to a lodge with a private pool which was ok. This is not luxurious accomodation. The game drives were great and we saw loads of animals . I would not go back , pick another reserve
reviews.title: Amazing animals!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 night at the end of our honeymoon. The accommodation was fantastic. We had a 3-bed lodge with a pool overlooking the valley. There were 2 game drives/ activities per day and a great atmosphere all the time, whether at dinner or out on the reserve. The rangers were all good fun and seemed to genuinely enjoy what they did. I would recommend to anyone in this area. Great game viewing was in abundance.
reviews.title: Really great time

reviews.text: We stayed at Kariega Lodge for 2 nights. Check in at 12.30pm, but that was for lunch, first game drive not till 4.30pm. Given an enormous 2 bedroom cabin to stay in, but found out that some cabins also have a private pool, but these don't seem to be booked, just first come, first served.
reviews.title: Kariega Lodge

description: Accommodation is in a large house in the middle of a private game reserve. Bedrooms have shared bathrooms. There is a shared lounge with a television, dining room and a fully equipped kitchen. There is also a lecture room in the house. The property has a large garden and swimming pool.
